abstract: Tornante, an investment firm run by the entertainment mogul Michael Eisner, and Madison Dearborn Partners, a private equity firm, have agreed to pay $385 million for Topps, the iconic but struggling maker of baseball cards and Bazooka gum. The deal is the latest — and perhaps the largest — for Mr. Eisner’s firm, which he created after leaving Disney in 2005.
